basics.name: Krish Joshi
basics.label: Principal Engineer & Cloud Architect
basics.headline: I architect systems that are secure by design, scalable by default, and invisible to the user
basics.tagline: Building robust cloud ecosystems that allow teams to move fast without breaking things.
basics.summary: Principal engineer with 14+ years of experience ranging from early-stage startups to FTSE 100 enterprises, specializing in bridging the gap between complex infrastructure and seamless product experiences. My philosophy is simple: developer experience is infrastructure. I build robust ecosystems—leveraging AWS, Serverless, and Identity standards (OAuth/FAPI)—that allow teams to move fast without breaking things. Currently pioneering AI-assisted engineering workflows and architecting the next generation of regulated Open Banking platforms. I lead from the front, establishing strong testing cultures (Playwright/Jest) and architectural standards that turn engineering teams into delivery engines.

philosophy.statement: I architect systems that protect their own integrity—enforcing quality through strict type safety, autonomous testing, and self-healing pipelines that empower teams to ship production code with zero anxiety.

principles.title: Latency First
principles.description: Optimization at the edge and cold-start reduction for serverless.

principles.title: Secure by Design
principles.description: IAM least-privilege, OAuth2/OIDC, and encrypted data planes as standard.

principles.title: Observable Systems
principles.description: Distributed tracing, metrics, and alerting from day one.

work.name: CaspianOne Open Banking
work.summary: Joined immediately post-launch to evolve a monolithic PoC into a scalable, production-hardened platform for regulated banking clients. Focused on architectural cleanup, performance optimization, and regulatory compliance in collaboration with the infrastructure team.
highlights: Refactored **legacy monolith into a maintainable distributed system**, establishing coding standards and decoupling patterns that enabled safe, rapid iteration.
Resolved critical latency issues through **dependency optimization and provisioned concurrency**, reducing **AWS Lambda cold starts by 40%** and ensuring sub-second transaction response times.
Implemented end-to-end **OpenTelemetry instrumentation across 12 microservices**, reducing **mean-time-to-diagnosis by 60%** and enabling proactive monitoring.
Led **FAPI 2.0/PSD2 authentication flows**, serving as technical authority on **OAuth2/OIDC security** for Canadian and EU banking standards.
work.stack: TypeScript, Next.js, AWS Lambda, DynamoDB, API Gateway, OpenTelemetry, Terraform, GitHub Actions, Jest, Playwright

work.name: Climatise
work.summary: Founding engineer for a Sustainability AI startup. Owned the entire engineering roadmap, building the cloud infrastructure and backend services from zero to launch.
highlights: Designed and built the **entire cloud estate on AWS**, achieving **Amazon Well-Architected status on the first submission**—a rare feat for an early-stage startup.
Pioneered the integration of **Generative AI (Amazon Bedrock/Claude)** into the core workflow, enabling businesses to automatically track and analyze carbon emissions via unstructured data.
Established a strict **IaC-first workflow using Terraform** to manage Cognito, Aurora, and Lambda across dev/staging/prod environments, ensuring **zero configuration drift**.
Built and led a **team of 5 senior engineers**, establishing code review standards, CI/CD practices, and architectural patterns that enabled the team to ship with confidence.
work.stack: NestJS, Node.js, TypeScript, REST APIs, AWS Lambda, Cognito, DynamoDB, Aurora, Terraform, GitHub Actions, Jest

work.name: Tesco
work.summary: Core member of the Identity & Account platform team, safeguarding the digital front door for 2M+ daily users. Focused on modernizing legacy authentication flows and improving system reliability at massive scale.
highlights: Implemented **WebAuthn (Passkeys) and modern MFA flows**, reducing **account compromise incidents by 60%** and significantly improving login conversion rates.
Orchestrated the migration of **monolithic legacy systems to agile Kubernetes-based micro-apps**, allowing for independent scaling and failure isolation.
Established **comprehensive E2E testing with Playwright**, achieving **90%+ coverage** and enabling daily deployments through automated regression suites.
Transformed release process from **weekly to daily deployments** through pipeline optimization and feature flagging.
work.stack: TypeScript, Node.js, React (SSR), Kubernetes, Azure Pipelines, Playwright, Jest

work.name: Chase UK (10x Future Tech)
work.summary: Part of the 'Banking as a Platform' team, building the ecosystem that enabled Chase Bank to launch in the UK. Built modular banking products that could be assembled rapidly.
highlights: Delivered **unified web and mobile experiences** using React and React Native, ensuring feature parity and code sharing between platforms to reduce developer overhead.
Integrated **Apigee and OAuth for secure API management**, ensuring our architecture met strict **FCA regulatory requirements** and internal banking security standards.
Built complex, long-running **account onboarding workflows using AWS Step Functions**, streamlining the customer journey from days to minutes.
Created **reusable component library** with Material UI and Storybook, adopted by **4 other product teams**.
work.stack: React (Redux, TypeScript, Formik, Storybook), React Native, Next.js, Node.js, Express, AWS Lambda, Step Functions, Cypress, Jest, Jenkins

work.name: Cisco
work.summary: Core contributor to Cisco's dCloud platform, a global environment enabling network simulation for engineers worldwide. Worked alongside the lead frontend architect to drive a massive modernization effort.
highlights: Co-led the strategic **migration from Angular 1 to modern React architecture**, executed with **zero downtime** and minimal user disruption, setting the standard for future Cisco web projects.
Optimization work on the new stack **improved application performance by 40%** and **reduced bundle sizes by 50%**, directly improving the experience for users in low-bandwidth regions.
Driving force behind the testing strategy, achieving **95% coverage across a distributed codebase** using Jest and Enzyme, establishing testing patterns adopted by the wider team.
Designed the **Node.js API layer schemas** that enabled scalable network topology visualization, replacing static diagrams with **interactive D3.js models**.
work.stack: Node.js, Express, React (TypeScript, Redux, Storybook, D3), React Native, AngularJS, Jest, Enzyme, Karma, Protractor, Selenium, Bootstrap, SASS, Jenkins
